item.title: 马来西亚捍卫美国贸易协议，主权担忧与日俱增
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）因与美国达成贸易协议而面临批评，马来西亚表示其主权仍然受到保护，不受美国制裁的约束。【原文：Malaysia said its sovereignty remains protected and it isn’t bound by sanctions imposed by US, as Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim faces criticism for a trade deal with the superpower.】

item.title: 韩国总统李明博在首次预算报告中将人工智能置于中心位置
item.description: 韩国总统李在明将人工智能作为其政府经济愿景的核心，承诺通过积极的人工智能投资和政策支持来改造国家的工业、公共服务和国防。【原文：South Korean President Lee Jae Myung placed artificial intelligence at the heart of his administration’s economic vision, pledging to transform the country’s industries, public services and defense through aggressive AI investment and policy support.】

item.title: 博裕为收购星巴克中国寻求约 14 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司博裕资本（Boyu Capital）正在与银行洽谈，以获得约 14 亿美元的贷款，支持其收购星巴克中国业务的多数股权。【原文：Private equity firm Boyu Capital is in talks with banks for a loan of around $1.4 billion-equivalent to support its acquisition of a majority stake in Starbucks Corp.’s China business, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日元逼近 155 日元，高盛认为没有立即干预的风险
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）认为日本近期进行货币干预的风险不大，称即使日元汇率接近 1 美元兑 155 日元，"尚未达到 "通常的触发点。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. sees little immediate risk of currency intervention in Japan, saying the usual triggers “have not yet been met” even as the yen approaches 155 per dollar.】

item.title: 印度顶级经纪商 Groww 承接 7.47 亿美元 IPO 订单
item.description: 印度最大的在线经纪商 Groww 的母公司将于周二开始接受投资者的首次公开募股订单，募集资金可能达到 663 亿卢比（约合 7.47 亿美元），这将帮助印度炙手可热的首次公开募股市场接近去年的纪录。【原文：The parent of Groww, India’s largest online broker, will start taking investor orders Tuesday for an initial public offering that may fetch 66.3 billion rupees ($747 million), helping the country’s hot IPO market approach last year’s record.】

item.title: 电动飞机制造商贝塔技术公司首次公开募股融资 10 亿美元
item.description: 电动飞机制造商贝塔科技公司（Beta Technologies Inc.【原文：Beta Technologies Inc., an electric-powered aircraft manufacturer, raised $1.02 billion in an upsized initial public offering, pricing above the marketed range despite turbulence created by the US government shutdown.】

item.title: 亚马逊称伯克希尔公用事业公司未能为数据中心供电
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）指控伯克希尔哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Amazon.com Inc. alleges that a Berkshire Hathaway Inc.-owned utility in Oregon is failing to provide sufficient power for four new data center facilities, highlighting the strain rapid expansion of technology facilities is putting on the electric grid.】

item.title: 高盛首席执行官认为大型并购交易将大量积压
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The current environment for large mergers and acquisitions is quite “constructive” for 2026 and 2027, particularly in the US, according to the chief executive officer of Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 马来西亚林吉特因利率前景和增长乐观而接近一年高点
item.description: 马来西亚的林吉特徘徊在一年来最强劲的水平附近，这是由于人们预期马来西亚央行将保持政策利率稳定，而且对经济增长重新感到乐观。【原文：Malaysia’s ringgit is hovering near its strongest level in a year, supported by expectations that the central bank will hold its policy rate steady and by renewed optimism over growth.】

item.title: 交易员解读美联储关于利率前景的评论，黄金下跌
item.description: 由于三位美联储政策制定者均未同意下月再次降息，黄金下跌，美元指数接近数月高点。【原文：Gold dropped as a trio of Federal Reserve policymakers stopped short of endorsing another interest-rate reduction next month, with a gauge of the US dollar trading near a multi-month high.】

item.title: 贝恩为收购服务逻辑公司申请 31 亿美元私人贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，贝恩资本已向私人信贷公司申请了 31 亿美元的债务融资，以从竞争对手 Leonard Green & Partners 手中收购 Service Logic。【原文：Bain Capital has lined up $3.1 billion of debt financing from private credit firms to acquire Service Logic from rival Leonard Green & Partners, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: WeRide 准备在香港上市融资 3.08 亿美元
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，WeRide Inc. 将通过出售香港股票筹集 23.9 亿港元（3.08 亿美元）的资金。【原文：WeRide Inc. is set to raise HK$2.39 billion ($308 million) from its Hong Kong share sale, according to people familiar with the matter, as it joins a slate of US-listed Chinese firms seeking a second listing in one of the world’s busiest markets.】

item.title: 智囊团称里夫斯面临的财政缺口小于预期
item.description: 据决议基金会（Resolution Foundation）称，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）需要填补的预算缺口将比人们普遍担心的要小，因为出乎意料的强劲薪资增长抵消了预期的生产率下降。【原文：The budget hole UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has to fill will be smaller than widely feared because unexpectedly strong pay growth has offset an anticipated productivity downgrade, according to the Resolution Foundation.】

item.title: 市场权衡欧佩克+暂停和供应过剩担忧，石油下跌
item.description: 由于市场权衡了欧佩克+明年初暂停增产的决定以及对供应的不同看法，石油在连续四天上涨后出现下滑。【原文：Oil dipped after a four-day run of gains as the market weighed OPEC+’s decision to pause output hikes early next year and contrasting views on supply.】

item.title: 中国力图在不下令削减供应的情况下重振炼钢业
item.description: 中国正在采取一种有节制的方法来整顿钢铁行业，改善高端企业的前景，但并没有下令进行必要的削减，以决定性地减少供应。【原文：China is taking a measured approach to fixing its steel industry, improving the outlook for high-end companies but steering clear of ordering the cuts needed to decisively shrink supply.】

item.title: 韩国物价飙升可能促使韩国央行延长宽松政策暂停期
item.description: 由于韩元走软抬高了能源和食品成本，韩国消费者通胀率在 10 月份有所加快，这也加强了央行延长货币宽松周期暂停时间的理由，因为央行正试图为房地产市场的涨势降温。【原文：South Korea’s consumer inflation quickened in October as a weaker won lifted energy and food costs, reinforcing the case for the central bank to extend the pause in its monetary easing cycle as it seeks to cool a housing market rally.】

item.title: 新产品助推需求增长，Grab 上调盈利预测
item.description: Grab Holdings Ltd.上调了今年的盈利预期，此前该公司的季度利润超过了预期，表明市场对这家东南亚打车和食品配送公司的新产品需求强劲。【原文：Grab Holdings Ltd. raised its earnings forecast for the year after quarterly profit topped estimates, signaling robust demand for the Southeast Asian ride-hailing and food delivery firm’s new products.】

item.title: 亚马逊交易后亚洲股市将追随科技股反弹：市场综述
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）与 OpenAI 公司 380 亿美元的交易重新点燃了市场对人工智能股票的热情，亚洲股市周二将追随华尔街的涨势而上涨。【原文：Asian stocks were set to gain Tuesday, tracking advances on Wall Street as Amazon.com Inc.’s $38 billion deal with OpenAI reignited enthusiasm for artificial-intelligence shares.】

item.title: 斯塔默警告将在即将到来的预算中做出 "艰难但公平 "的决定
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）警告说，他的政府将在本月晚些时候的增税预算中做出 "艰难但公平的决定"。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer warned that his government will make “tough but fair decisions” in what’s expected to be a tax-raising budget later this month.】

item.title: KKR 计划扩大对印度保险部门的投资
item.description: KKR & Co Inc. 的高层管理人员表示，随着这家投资公司在印度信贷、基础设施和私募股权领域的扩张，该公司正计划让其印度保险部门发挥更大的作用。【原文：KKR & Co Inc. is planning a bigger role for its India insurance unit, as the investment firm expands in credit, infrastructure and private equity in the country, its top executives said.】

item.title: 国土安全部削减地方网络支持，美国选举安全面临考验
item.description: 从纽约市到新泽西州和弗吉尼亚州，全美各地的选民都在准备周二的投票，而选举官员却在联邦政府机构大幅减少支持的情况下开展工作，该机构之前曾帮助各州和地方政府应对炸弹威胁和网络攻击。【原文：As voters across the US from New York City to New Jersey and Virginia prepare to cast ballots Tuesday, election officials are operating with sharply reduced support from a federal government agency that had previously helped states and localities counter bomb threats and cyberattacks.】

item.title: 前网络安全人员被控兼职黑客
item.description: 美国检方在法庭文件中指控，网络安全公司的三名员工多年来兼职黑客，发动自己的勒索软件攻击阴谋，向全国各地的受害者勒索数百万美元。【原文：Three employees at cybersecurity companies spent years moonlighting as criminal hackers, launching their own ransomware attacks in a plot to extort millions of dollars from victims around the country, US prosecutors alleged in court filings.】

item.title: Clorox 在业务工作流程转型中保持年度展望
item.description: Clorox 公司维持其全年营收和盈利展望，称其运营软件变更带来的干扰已基本消除，下半年的目标是加快利润增长。【原文：Clorox Co. maintained its full-year revenue and earnings outlook, saying the disruptions from changes in its operational software were mostly behind it and it is aiming to accelerate profit growth in the second half of the year.】

item.title: 新月公司将以 4 亿美元向 Aethel 出售落基山脉资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.支持的得克萨斯州石油生产商新月能源公司（Crescent Energy Co.）同意将其在美国落基山地区的钻井组合出售给 Aethel Energy。【原文：Crescent Energy Co., a Texas oil producer backed by KKR & Co., agreed to sell its drilling portfolio in the US Rocky Mountain region to Aethel Energy, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Palantir 在股价创历史新高后上调销售预测
item.description: Palantir Technologies Inc. 将其年收入预期上调至 44 亿美元，第三季度销售额超出分析师预期，理由是其人工智能和数据分析产品实现了 "加速和超乎寻常 "的增长。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc. raised its annual revenue outlook to $4.4 billion and outpaced analyst estimates for third-quarter sales, citing “accelerating and otherworldly” growth for its artificial intelligence and data analytics products.】

item.title: Oncoclinicas 股东要求就 IPO 股权问题传唤高盛
item.description: Oncoclínicas do Brasil Servicos Medicos SA 的小股东希望质询高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Minority shareholders in Oncoclínicas do Brasil Servicos Medicos SA want to question Goldman Sachs Group Inc. about whether the bank’s ownership stake in the Brazilian cancer treatment chain was misstated in the prospectus for its 2021 initial public offering.】

item.title: 美国财政部下调 10-12 月借款预期至 5,690 亿美元借款预期降至 5690 亿美元
item.description: 美国财政部下调了本季度联邦借款的预期，主要原因是本季度初现金余额较高。【原文：The US Treasury lowered its borrowing estimate for federal borrowing for the current quarter, primarily due to the higher cash balance at the beginning of the quarter.】

item.title: 电动飞机的时代即将到来，Beta 吸引了大量首次公开募股订单
item.description: 随着电动飞机开发商贝塔科技公司（Beta Technologies Inc.【原文：Investors are warming to Beta Technologies Inc.’s IPO as the electric aircraft developer and its peers look to distance themselves from unhappy associations with the 2021 blank-check company boom and bust.】

item.title: 阿波罗同意向 Orsted 风电场投资 65 亿美元
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司管理的基金同意向 Orsted A/S 的 Hornsea 3 号项目投资 65 亿美元，该项目是世界上最大的海上风电项目之一。【原文：Funds managed by Apollo Global Management Inc. agreed to invest $6.5 billion in Orsted A/S’s Hornsea 3, the UK offshore wind project that’s among the world’s largest.】

item.title: 麦格理合规打击导致石油交易员出走
item.description:
世界顶级大宗商品银行的石油和天然气交易因几位关键人物的离职而放缓。【原文：

At the world’s top commodities bank, oil and gas trading has slowed amid several key departures.

】
